author: Special Correspondent
text:
Passengers of a State-run bus had a providential escape when the speeding vehicle hit a stationary van on the Melur-Madurai highway at Narasingampatti in the early hours of Tuesday.

The police said that the bus was proceeding to Madurai from Tiruchi when the driver, Jayaprakash, is suspected to have dozed off losing control over the vehicle around 5.15 a.m.

The bus rammed the paddy-laden cargo vehicle. The front portion of the bus was badly damaged. Farmers, who were around at the paddy fields for irrigation, rushed to the rescue of the injured, said the vice-president of Narasingampatti panchayat, M. Kannan. The driver got stuck with his leg caught in the mangled steering wheel.

Fire and Rescue Service personnel from Melur struggled for more than 30 minutes to relieve him. Ten passengers sustained minor injuries, the police said.

The Melur police are investigating.
title: 10 hurt as bus rams van
